Michael Luu

          Michael Luu, MPH

          Bio
          Michael Luu, MPH, is a research biostatistician at the
          Samuel Oschin Comprehensive Cancer Institute. Luu received his
          master’s in public health with an emphasis in biostatistics
          and epidemiology at the University of Southern California in
          2015. He is a proficient R programmer who was also trained in
          SAS, STATA and SPSS. His experience involves survival
          analysis, predictive modeling and data visualizations, among
          other areas. Current and past projects involve analysis of
          large national inpatient databases such as the National Cancer
          Database, SEER-Medicare from the National Cancer Institute,
          Healthcare Cost and Utilization Project, California’s Office
          of Statewide Health Planning and Development and Pediatrics
          Health Information Systems. Before joining Cedars-Sinai in
          2016, he served as a biostatistician at Children’s Hospital
          Los Angeles for the Division of Neonatology and Department of
          Anesthesia Critical Care Medicine.
          
          
          Education
          University of Southern California | Los Angeles, CA
          M.P.H in Biostatistics & Epidemiology | 2015
          University of California, Irvine | Irvine, CA
          B.Sc. in Biological Sciences | 2009
          
          
          Experience
          Research Biostatistician II | Cedars-Sinai Cancer Center |
          2016 - Present
          Research Biostatistican I | Children’s Hospital Los Angeles
          | 2016 - 2016
          Quality Improvement Analyst | Children’s Hospital Los
          Angeles | 2015-2016
          Epidemiology & Outcomes Research Intern | Children’s
          Hospital Los Angeles | 2014-2015
